html:
come bending/bow themselves down. Whereas historically Israel had been the slaves, the former victors will come on their knees to Israel's Zion (45:14-15; 49:23), attracted by its glory.

The city of the Lord/Zion. These are names for the New Jerusalem, reflecting its state of being and role as the center point of Zion. Ezekiel gives another name for the city: "The Lord is there" (Ezek. 48:35). Isaiah spoke of Zion more often than any other Old Testament writer (forty-five times).
